head.supplied: February 27 [186]3 ¶ My dear Sir ¶ ¶ The Secretary has shown me the authority issued to him by yourself on behalf of the Trustees; but I think it is not extensive enough. What the Council wish him to...

div.p: No. 63/304, unit 2, p. 400, VPRS 2225 outward letter press copy books, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The Secretary has shown me the authority issued to him by yourself on behalf of the Trustees; but I think it is not extensive enough. What the Council wish him to have is the same authority as was possessed by the late Superintendent viz to act as ranger of the Park so far as the Trustees can give him that authority. With the document you have sent he is quite powerless to prevent any person destroying the fence or otherwise misconducting himself.

note.p: Written by George Sprigg, Honorary Secretary, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria. Thomas Black, Acting President of the Society presumably signed the original copy of this letter.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt; font-weight: bold;

note.p: **Anything in the minutes to give a context — either of Royal Park or Acclim. Soc.?

div.p: To Ferdinand Mueller Esq M.D. F.R.S.
